course.title: French Social Thought, Durkheim to Foucault
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 11:30–1, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.description: A survey of major themes and debates in modern French social theory over the span of a century, from Durkheim's neo-Kantian theory of the social symbolic to Foucault's conception of the historical a priori, concluding with the recent emergence of neo-liberal conceptions of both history and society. Major readings by Durkheim, Mauss, Sartre, Kojeve, Fanon, de Beauvoir, Levi-Strauss, Lacan, Althusser, Foucault, Lefort, Derrida, and Bourdieu.
